Courses.Name: MUSIC 0914 - PIANO REQUIREMENT

Courses.Name: MUSIC 3199A - EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING
Description: Students who will complete an experiential or service learning opportunity may pre-apply for conditional approval to have the work recognized for academic credit. Eligible initiatives include (but are not limited to): Internships; Western Heads East; approved service-learning experiences.
Antirequisite(s): The same course offered through any other Faculty.
Extra Information: 0.5 course, pass/fail

NOTE: Academic credit will be given for the course in the same academic year in which approval was given. Students must consult with the Dean of the Faculty (or designate) prior to departure and present a detailed   study/research/work plan. The Dean, in consultation with appropriate departmental advisers will provide the student with detailed criteria which must be fulfilled in order to gain credit for the course. These criteria (in the form of a `contract` to be signed by the student and the Dean), may include, but are not limited to: a detailed report of results (with a specified format/length), a detailed diary or blog, a reflection on the learning experience, an oral presentation to peers and faculty.

The student will report to the Dean upon return or completion of the experience.   No credit will be given without prior approval of the Dean and a failing grade will be assigned if students do not fulfill the pre-approved reporting arrangement.

This course may not be used as a substitute for any other course offered by the Faculty of Music, but may count towards the 15.0, 20.0, or 22.0 courses required for graduation, by special permission of the Dean.

Courses.Name: MUSIC 4954Y - PERCUSSION ENSEMBLE
Description: The rehearsal and performance of a broad range of percussion ensemble repertoire including standard, world, jazz and contemporary styles. Further technical, musical and organization skills building on applied study are explored.
Extra Information: 3 hours. Open to Music Students only.

Notes: REQUISITES: Corequisite(s): Open only to students also enrolled in Studio Percussion Music 1920, Music 2920, Music 3920, Music 4920, Music 2921, Music 3921, Music 4921, Music 3922, Music 4922, Music 4923, Music 1925, Music 2925, Music 3925, Music 4925, Music 3924Y, Music 4924Y, Music 3929 or Music 4929.

Courses.Name: MUSIC 4961Y - VOCAL PEDAGOGY
Description: A comprehensive survey of voice technique and the methods of voice training, from historical Bel Canto treatises to the most recent scientific studies. Available to vocal students.
Extra Information: 1.5 hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO STUDENTS IN THE FACULTY OF MUSIC.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Music 1920.

Courses.Name: MUSIC 4970 - OPERA WORKSHOP
Description: Performing and technical aspects of the production of opera, including musical and dramatic interpretation, stage movement, techniques of stagecraft, lighting, scene construction, make-up, costumes.
Extra Information: 4 hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO STUDENTS IN THE FACULTY OF MUSIC. ALSO HELD IN MB 27 AND MB 227.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Music 3970

Courses.Name: MUSIC 4971A - EARLY MUSIC STUDIO
Description: The study and performance of repertoire composed before 1800 with attention to historical performance practices. The ensemble performs on period instruments.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO STUDENTS IN THE FACULTY OF MUSIC. HELD IN MB 210.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Music 3971A/B or Music 3972A/B

Courses.Name: MUSIC 4973A - CHAMBER ORCHESTRA
Description: The study and performance of selected works from the Chamber Orchestra repertoire with an emphasis on music of the twentieth century. An audition is required.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO STUDENTS IN THE FACULTY OF MUSIC.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Music 3973A/B or Music 3974B.

Description: The study and performance of selected works from the Chamber Orchestra repertoire with an emphasis on music of the twentieth century. An audition is required.

Courses.Name: MUSIC 4975Y - APPLIED CHAMBER MUSIC II
Description: The study and performance of selected works in the chamber music repertoire. An audition may be required. Students accepted into the course will be assigned to small ensembles, with or without keyboard.
Extra Information: 2 hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO STUDENTS IN THE FACULTY OF MUSIC. SHARED WITH MUSIC 2975Y AND 3975Y. ONE HOUR TO BE ARRANGED.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Music 3975Y

Courses.Name: MUSIC 4976Y - COLL MUSICIANSHP PIANO & ORCH
Description: A course intended to teach the pianist and orchestral instrumentalist the principles of ensemble playing as well as the literature of the Solo Instrumental Works with piano. Designed for students majoring in Piano or Orchestral Instruments in Honours Performance, in third or fourth year. Available to other students by permission of the Department.
Extra Information: 3 hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO STUDENTS IN THE FACULTY OF MUSIC.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Music 2921 or Music 2920.
Corequisite(s): Music 3930A/B/Y or the former Music 3926.
